programme.title: Alain Resnais, l'audacieux
programme.desc:
An eccentric, disconcerting film-maker, brilliant inventor of new styles. In the shadows of the New Wave, Alain Resnais (1922-2014) left an indelible mark on European cinema. "On Connaît la Chanson", "L'Année Dernière à Marienbad", "Hiroshima Mon Amour"... A look back at the career of a discreet nonconformist.

Directed by: Pierre-Henri Gibert (France, 2022)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: The Petite Camargue, proud and intrepid A journey through the Petite Camargue, where the Rhône meets the Mediterranean, one of Europe's largest wetland reserves. The Camargue: home to herds of white horses galloping through the marshes, massive black bulls, vast stretches of water shared by flamingos and other water birds. Plus so many other fabulous surprises... Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc:
Programme summary: Baptiste Saulnier, gardener at the Château de Chambord; vegetable oils for the cosmetics industry; the landscapes of the Camargue.
Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Pistes vertes
programme.desc: Visit to an animal farm at Vauville in the Manche. Encounter with Christophe, a baker who produces his own wheat and flour. In Seine-Maritime, Audrey and Thomas have opened a gite in their garden to encourage biodiversity. Maxime, a cabinet maker, creates furniture using reclaimed wood. Presenter: Laurent Quembre.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Cheese from Kelowna In Kelowna, the master cheese-maker Sandra produces a range of cow and goat milk cheeses which delight food lovers. Wearing his hairnet, Luc discovers their production secrets. Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Faïencerie de Gien/Porter la ceinture et le motif à fleurs
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Bora-Bora (Polynésie française) Découverte des marchands des bords de route de Bora-Bora. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Trellis With a passion for wood, Thibaut Mallet designs and makes a surprisingly diverse range of objects. In the garden, trellis takes on a multitude of different forms to create shade or set the scene. High-flying craftsmanship by experts. Visiting the gardens of the Chateau de Saint-Marcel-de-Félines. Don't panic: Brigitte's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Dangerous crevices The young climbers and their guide leave Rifugio Monzino heading for the foot of Mont-Blanc, where they hope to pitch their first bivouac. To do so, they must cross a crevice-covered glacier. Time to apply everything they learned. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Beet cupcakes
Ricardo prepares a root vegetable for dessert: beet cupcakes topped with mascarpone cream and drizzled with beet syrup.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
En-route for the Gras de Douarnenez
With five days of festivities the Gras de Douarnenez is a carnival on a grand scale! One of the last in Brittany or even in France, this fabulous celebration, open to everyone and every age, sees the entire town dress up and enjoy a chance to laugh at absolutely anything. Report by: Nina Montagné.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Exploring the French National Archives. Encounter with Émilie Bonaventure, the multidisciplinary creator at the head of the Be-Attitude agency: design, scenography, art, architecture. Paris in the footsteps of the writer Simone de Beauvoir. With Papiers à Êtres, Sophie Mouton-Perrat and Frédéric Guibrunet offer radiant, diaphanous sculptures as light as paper. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In Paris we head off to visit to the Pantheon. Prepare to enter those areas where no-one else goes! Then an encounter with Philippe Perissé, a fashion designer inspired by the world of heroines. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Voyages vert vous
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Trellis With a passion for wood, Thibaut Mallet designs and makes a surprisingly diverse range of objects. To do so, they must cross a crevice-covered glacier. Time to apply everything they learned. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc:
The Liberation of Paris Museum/Pierre Marty/Off-White/Plumavera.
The Liberation of Paris Museum recounts the Second World War. Chef Pierre Marty at work in the kitchens of "Ducasse sur Seine", a boat unlike any other. Off-White, with its extravagant fabrics and over-sized volumes. An in-depth look at Plumavera's exquisite expertise with feathers.
Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Magret de canard aux quatre baies
programme.desc: Duck breast with a four pepper sauce Pasquale Vari presents her duck breast with roast Brussels sprouts and explains how to make a four pepper sauce. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Maison de vétéran In the middle of the 20th century, to solve the housing crisis, Canada saw the construction of tens of thousands of quick-build houses, each to the same square design: known as "wartime housing" or "maisons de vétérans". Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Basilica Cathedral of Saint-Denis in the footsteps of the French kings. Encounter with the designer Ionna Vautrin. Some of the most energising and flavoursome addresses, for caffeine-addicts in search of a really good coffee! Stained glass: from cathedrals to traditional or contemporary homes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Brock and East York, Ontario
In Brock, Ontario, Louis saves the life of a large number of frogs. In Toronto, he comes to the rescue of six skunks.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Nordic food Three guests born in Scandinavia come together to cook dishes from their respective regions: Sweden, Norway and Denmark. Mahée Paiement joins the gang to relive her travel memories! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.sub-title: Le best of de la saison
programme.desc: Season's highlights For this final programme, Katharina Locher catches up with the gardeners in an exceptional spot: the MFO Park in Zurich. Between walls and columns of greenery, they look back at the best moments of the season. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Fashion special Behind the scenes at the Grévin Museum. Encounter with Jason Basmajian, artistic director for Cerruti 1881, a Parisian fashion house with a Hollywood accent and Italian roots. Paris, in the footsteps of the designer Yves Saint Laurent. The feather obeys his every whim, Maxime Leroy, feather artisan. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 1

A little crooked house... but can a house really be crooked, literally? Who lives in a villa with direct lake access? How to blossom in a rainbow-coloured house next to a railway line? Viola Tami invites us to discover some surprising buildings and their occupants. Presented by: Viola Tami.

Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc:
Aravis, around Annecy
Laurent invites us to join him as he discovers this region between Lake Annecy and the Aravis mountain range, as seen by those who live there.
Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Mancelles Alps
At the GAEC de la Phacélie, deep in the hills and valleys of the Mancelles Alps, Gaël collects propolis from his hives. Cyril and Florence grow Damask roses. One thing is clear: catching butterflies is no easy business! All about the Confrérie des Fins Goustiers du Haut-Maine et Pail.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Warming yourself in Haut-Doubs: mission impossible? Spanning Doubs, Switzerland and Jura, at an altitude of 1,000 metres we find the Val de Mouthe. In the white wonderland of Haut-Doubs, you'd be forgiven for thinking that you're at the North Pole, in the forests of Lapland. Is it possible to get warm in Haut-Doubs ? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a familiar yet little-known Paris monument, the Petit Palais. Between porcelain and jewellery, Alix D.Reynis reinvents jewellery inspired by history. Paris on film, in the footsteps of Amélie Poulain. Focus on Ateliers Baudin where Jurassic tradition takes on contemporary style with bespoke eyewear in horn frames. Presented by: Katherina Marx
